1.text: Therefore, you are without excuse, if you are judging! For in passing judgment on another, you condemn yourself, because you pass judgment and yet practice the same things.

2.text: We know that the judgment of God is according to truth and against those who practice such things.

3.text: Do you think that you will escape the judgment of God if you judge those who practice such things and yet act the same?

4.text: Or do you despise the riches of God’s goodness, tolerance, and patience, not knowing that his goodness leads you to repentance?

5.text: But according to your hardness and unrepentant heart, you are storing up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath, revelation, and of the righteous judgment of God.

6.text: He “will pay back to everyone according to their works;”

7.text: [which is] eternal life to those who by perseverance in good works seek glory, honor, and incorruptibility.

8.text: However, to those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth but unrighteousness, there will be retribution and intense wrath,

9.text: oppression and anguish. Trouble and distress will come to everyone who does evil, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

10.text: On the other hand, glory, honor, and peace [are] for everyone who does good; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek,

11.text: because there is no partiality with God.

12.text: Hence, all those who have sinned apart from the law will also perish without the law, [and] as many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.

13.text: For it is not the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law will be declared righteous.

14.text: (Indeed, when Gentiles who do not have the law do by nature the things of the law, they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law,

15.text: by showing that the practical expression of the law is written in their hearts. Their conscience bears witness, and their thoughts alternately accuse or defend them).

16.text: This is for the day when, according to my [proclamation of the] Gospel, God, through Jesus Christ, will judge the secret thoughts of all.

17.text: Indeed, you [who] bear the name of Jew, you rely on the law and glory in God.

18.text: You know his will, and approve the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law.

19.text: You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness,

20.text: a corrector of the foolish and a teacher of infants, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

21.text: You therefore who teach another, [why] do you not teach yourself? You who preach that one should not steal, [why] do you steal?

22.text: You who say that a man should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?

23.text: You who glory in the law by your disobedience of the law, [why] do you dishonor God?

24.text: For “the Name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,” just as it is written.

25.text: Indeed, circumcision gains something if you are a doer of the law, but if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

26.text: And so, if an uncircumcised man keeps the ordinances of the law, will not his uncircumcision be accounted as circumcision?

27.text: Will not the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfills the law, judge you, who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law?

28.text: For one is not a Jew by being so outwardly, neither is that circumcision [true circumcision] which is outward in the flesh.

29.text: Instead, someone is a Jew by being one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit and not in the letter. Truly, their praise is not from human beings but from God.
